p: The influences of inclusion of oregano essential oil in a reduced-protein diet on selected microbial populations in ileal digesta are shown in Figure 1. Dietary treatments had no significant effect on total bacteria. The NPD- and RPO-fed pigs had a higher ( p < 0.05) population of Lactobacillus in ileal digesta than those in the RPD- and RPA-fed pigs. The RPA-fed pigs exhibited the lowest ( p < 0.05) population of Lactobacillus. In addition, the population of Escherichia coli in the RPA and RPO treatment was lower than in the NPD and RPD treatment.
